Choices: A) The motion of the satellite will remain the same unless a collision with a meteoroid occurs., B) Even if a collision with a meteoroid occurs, the motion of the satellite would remain the same., C) The meteoroid and the satellite would exert equal force on each other if a collision with a meteoroid occurs., D) If a collision with a meteoroid occurs, the amount of force acting on the satellite would depend on the size and speed of the meteoroid. Scenario Justification: No phenomenon or scenario. Pure recall/definition question.
SEP Justification: Some prediction required but in straightforward context.
DCI Justification: Direct recall of definition or fact. No reasoning with DCI.
CCC Justification: No CCC engagement. No patterns, cause/effect, or systems thinking required.
